She wants to investigate what happened to her mother, who committed suicide when she was ten years old, and to her apathetic and traumatized father, a man who seems to hide a terrible secret. A direct sequel to the horror thriller Nightwatch, one of the most successful Danish films in history.

Film International Title: Sanatorium Under The Sign of the Hourglass
Film Original Title: Sanatorium Under The Sign of the Hourglass
Film Synopsis (en): Inspired by the novel of the same name by Bruno Schulz, this baroque tale of temporal distortions marks the return to feature length by the Quay Brothers, leading exponents of stop-motion animation. A man travels to a sanatorium in Eastern Europe after being informed that his father has died there. When he arrives, however, he finds him alive, but only now and then. This is how he discovers that a strange spatial distortion is taking place inside the sanatorium.

Director Biography: Busan-born director whose short filmThe Line(2013) was nominated at the Cannes Film Festival. Noise is his feature debut.
Film Synopsis (en): Ju-young is a young woman with a hearing impediment who decides to investigate her sister's inexplicable disappearance, last seen in her apartment. Feeling more and more cornered, Ju-young begins to hear strange sounds and sense an evil presence in the apartment. Tons of intrigue and unease in this debut film that is reminiscent of J-horror, and which provides a good indication of the health of South Korean horror.
